column4: My laptop won't connect to my mother's wireless. It hangs on "Obtaining IP address." Help?
your not giving alot of info: like does it connect elsewhere... is your mom's AP encrypted; if so, what type of encryption?
Yes, it normally connects to networks. No encryption.
are you trying to connect useing encryption (even though the AP isn't encrypted)?
It also does this with the wireless at a library, and I think someone once said something about "dhcp problem" being the cause.
ok... do you have any rules set up in your psk_supplicant file?
Never accessed it, so I assume no?
can you request an IP from the AP?
when you go to add a network, select Wireless, Add, and go to the IPv4 Settings tab, select Manual in the Method drop and type in "standard" ip that matches the base scheme of the network
I know the settings you refer to, but I'm not sure how to access them on my laptop. I normally get there by right-clicking the connection icon in the tray, but the only one there is the wicd icon.
right click Panel, add to panel, network manager
....nope, not listed in the Add to Panel menu.
